entries: When you imbibe this potion, your eyes become catlike, and you can choose their color. For the next hour, you gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision} from another source, its range increases by 30 feet.
{@font {@style 23|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Liquid Mending
entries: Also known as "craftsman in a bottle," this well-loved potion is found in most homes and shops. You can pour this potion over an object to repair a single break or tear in it, as if by the {@spell Mending} spell.
{@font {@style 24|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Liquid Lockpick
entries: Although frowned upon in many villages, this useful potion is still sought after by many islanders for both wholesome and nefarious reasons. You can pour the potion into a lock, loosening the mechanism inside and decreasing the DC to pick it by {@dice 1d4}. Once a lock's DC is reduced by this potion, its DC can't be reduced by another liquid lockpick potion. The effects of this potion last for 1 hour.
{@font {@style 25|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Language Lore
entries: This grayish potion tastes like chewed-up paper. For 1 hour after drinking it, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear.
{@font {@style 26|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Pig Snout
entries: After drinking this pink pastel potion, there is a brief uncomfortable transformation, where the imbiber grows a beautiful, snuffling pig snout. For the next hour, you become very fond of truffles, perhaps even to the point of belligerence, and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.
{@font {@style 27|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Machine Oil
entries: When poured over a machine that is in working condition, this dark black liquid powers up the device, allowing it to function as if it were whelmed by a spirit or activated by the Jolt spell. The machine stays powered by this potion for 1 minute.
{@font {@style 28|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Potion of Soft Steps
entries: When you drink this frothy brew, you float an inch off the ground and walk on a cushion of air. For the next 10 minutes, you gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks, and you leave no discernible tracks.
{@font {@style 29|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Liquid Cat
entries: This lively swirling concoction transforms and solidifies into a friendly cat when poured out. The cat serves you as a familiar, as if from the {@spell Find Familiar} spell. The cat disappears after 24 hours.
{@font {@style 30|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Twin Vision
entries: This potion must be shared with another creature, each of them ingesting half of the potion. When the second half of the potion is consumed, the first creature gains the ability to see through the eyes of the second creature, gaining the benefits of any special senses that creature has. While seeing in this way, the first creature is blind with regard to its own senses. Either creature can use its action to stop shared vision or reactivate it. This ability lasts for 8 hours, and it can't be used if the creatures are more than 1 mile apart.
{@font {@style 31|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Spirit Repellent
entries: This potion can either be imbibed or poured on a 1-foot square, causing the nearby area to become repulsive to spirits. Any spirit that has a challenge rating of 5 or lower within 30 feet of you or the square must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the spirit is teleported to a random unoccupied space that is 35 feet away from you or the square and can't willingly move to a space within range for 1 minute. A spirit that hasn't made this save must immediately do so if it moves within range, becoming affected by the repellant for the duration on a failed save.
{@font {@style 32|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Essence of the River Spirit
entries: This small, stoppered vial contains a clear liquid that shimmers with a faint blue light. When the vial is opened, you can pour the liquid into a small pool of water, such as a bath or hot spring, transforming it into a healing pool. A creature that soaks in the pool for at least 10 minutes regains {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points. The pool loses its magic after 1 hour or once six creatures have benefited from this effect.
{@font {@style 33|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Potion of Freezing
entries: Pouring this grayish-blue potion into any liquid will cause that liquid to freeze solid for 1 hour, after which it begins to thaw as normal. This effect can freeze no more than a 20-foot cube of liquid.
{@font {@style 34|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Potion of Attunement
entries: As an action, you can pour a drop of this potion onto a magic item that requires attunement and drink the rest. Once you do so, you instantly become attuned to that item.
{@font {@style 35|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Water Breathing
entries: This tropical fruity elixir tastes just as delicious as your favorite juice. For the duration, you can breathe underwater. The effects of the potion last for 1 hour.
{@font {@style 36|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Liquid Dispel
entries: When thrown at a creature, object, or magical effect within 30 feet of you, this potion breaks, releasing its contents on the target. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target immediately ends.
{@font {@style 37|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Pocket Stomach
entries: When imbibed, your stomach temporarily functions as a {@item bag of holding}, allowing you to store any object you can fit in your mouth inside its extradimensional space. The effects of this potion last for 1 hour, after which you throw up anything consumed.
{@font {@style 38|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Liquid Arcana
entries: The brewer of this potion rolls a {@dice d4} to determine the maximum level of the spell slot it can restore. When you drink it, you immediately regain an expended spell slot of that level or lower.
{@font {@style 39|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Arcane Solvent
entries: When this potion is applied to a magic item, any creature that was attuned to it is no longer attuned. If the item is being worn or carried by the attuned creature, it can resist the effects of this potion with a successful DC 13 Wisdom saving throw.
{@font {@style 40|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Gardner's Solution
entries: When this oily, greenish potion is rubbed on a plant, the plant instantly grows to full maturity. If the plant is too big for the space—such as a redwood tree—it will stop growing once it has reasonably filled the space. If the potion is imbibed, it does nothing, but it tastes like maple syrup.
{@font {@style 41|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Potion of Exertion
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain a surge of manic energy allowing you to take another action this round at initiative count 1.
{@font {@style 42|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Breakfast in a Bottle
entries: The brewer of this potion rolls a {@dice d4} to determine the number of servings it creates. When poured out, this liquid quickly forms into an appetizing breakfast, such as some bread or pancakes. A creature that consumes a serving of it feels satiated for the day, and its {@condition exhaustion} level is reduced by 1. It takes 1 minute to consume one serving, and once a creature benefits from this effect, it can't do so again until it finishes a long rest. The food spoils after 24 hours, losing its magic.
{@font {@style 43|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Twin Telepathy
entries: This potion must be shared with another creature, each of them ingesting half of the potion. When consumed, the potion allows the imbibers to communicate telepathically across any distance. The effects of this potion last for 24 hours.
{@font {@style 44|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Potion of Reprieve
entries: When imbibed, this potion offers temporary relief from an ill effect. For the next hour, you gain the benefit of an effect of your choice from the {@spell Greater Restoration} spell. When this potion's effects end, you lose the chosen benefit, causing the ill effect to return.
{@font {@style 45|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Uncanny Focus
entries: For 1 minute after imbibing this purplish liquid, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain {@status concentration} on spells. In addition, becoming {@condition incapacitated} doesn't cause you to lose {@status concentration} on a spell.
{@font {@style 46|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Meditative Trance
entries: This violet-colored potion smells like lavender and citrus. The next time you take a short rest after ingesting it, you enjoy a deep, dreamless sleep, granting you the benefits of a long rest, even if you already benefited from a long rest in the past 24 hours.
{@font {@style 47|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Potion of Holistic Wellness
entries: When you uncork this potion of scintillating liquid, your senses are calmed with the smell of vanilla and honey along with a warm spring breeze. When imbibed, you feel like your whole soul is embraced in a loving hug, causing you to regain {@dice 4d8 + 4} hit points, and removing any conditions affecting you, excluding the {@condition grappled}, {@condition prone}, or {@condition restrained} condition.
{@font {@style 48|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Sharp Mind
entries: When you drink this potion, your mind becomes charged with magical energy. For the next 8 hours, you gain a +2 bonus to Intelligence saving throws, and you gain resistance to psychic damage. In addition, you can devour whole tomes of text, reading 10 times faster than normal.
{@font {@style 49|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Mind Over Might
entries: When consumed, this chalky elixir turns an intellectual scholar into an athlete. For the next 24 hours, you can use your Intelligence or Wisdom modifier (your choice), in place of your Strength or Dexterity modifier, when making Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks. You also gain proficiency in those skills for the duration, if you don't already have it.
{@font {@style 50|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Simulacrum Elixir
entries: When consumed, this numbing concoction sends you into a deep sleep. When you awake, your mind has taken over a perfect clone of yourself. The clone appears to be the same as you in every way, but it has half of your hit point maximum and is formed without any equipment other than mundane clothes. Otherwise, the clone uses all of your statistics, except that it is a construct. The clone lacks the ability to learn or become more powerful, so it never increases its level or other abilities, nor can it regain expended spell slots.

While the clone exists, your original body stays in a constant deep sleep, where it requires no nourishment, but it can still suffer damage as normal. The clone lasts until you dismiss it or it drops to 0 hit points, at which point it disappears in a cloud of butterflies. When it disappears, your mind returns to your original body.
{@font {@style 51|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Hidden Hand
entries: When consumed, this grainy potion heightens your senses and gives you a sunken feeling of untapped strength. For the next 24 hours, you gain telekinetic powers as if you were under the effects of the {@spell Telekinesis} spell.
{@font {@style 52|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Last Resort
entries: When this potion is downed, a crystalline cocoon begins forming around you. The cocoon becomes fully formed at the start of your next turn, and you can't be contacted or interacted with in any way. The cocoon is immune to all damage, and it can't be moved or destroyed by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell. While in the cocoon, you are in stasis and don't need to eat or breathe. The cocoon lasts between 1 hour and 4 decades. Roll on the table below to determine the measurement of time for the effect, from hours to decades. Then roll a {@dice d4} to determine the exact amount of time the cocoon exists.
{@font {@style 53|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Elixir of Echoes
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the ability to cast a spell that was cast by another creature within the last minute. The spell has to have been cast within 100 feet of you, and you must be aware that the spell was cast. Once imbibed, you can cast the copied spell once within the next minute, without expending a spell slot or material components. If the spell requires a saving throw or spell attack roll, you use the DC and attack bonus of the creature that originally cast the spell.
{@font {@style 54|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Blessing of the Moon Spirit
entries: After drinking this potion, which glows like a full moon, you gain a strange and wondrous affinity for the moon's light. This potion's effects are {@b permanent}.
While moonlight touches you, you can use a bonus action to expend three hit dice. You can use this ability once per long rest.
When you first consume this potion, your hit point maximum is increased by {@dice 2d10}. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting you at once.
{@font {@style 55|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Bowark's Bombastic Beer
entries: This potion was discovered by accident by the great brewmaster, Bowark. Unsealing it fills the room with a strong scent of hops and yeasty goodness. When consumed, this beer gives you a warm, euphoric calm that makes you feel like everything will be alright. Until this potion's effects end, you can choose to reroll any ability check, attack roll, or saving throw you make. You can reroll in this way a total of 7 times before the potion wears off.
{@font {@style 56|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Unified Might
entries: When consumed, this potion produces a burning sensation that fills your body, leaving you with newfound intellectual and physical strength. For the next hour, two ability scores of your choice increase to 25.
{@font {@style 57|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Umi's Powerful Undertow
entries: This potent elixir allows the drinker to enhance their aquatic spells with the ocean's wrath. For the next hour, when you cast a spell that produces or manipulates water in some capacity, the spell is cast as if using a spell slot of one level higher. Additionally, spells that use water to deal damage to a creature or object deal an extra {@damage 2d12} bludgeoning damage.

Alternatively, you can throw the potion into an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you, breaking the glass and summoning three water elementals in the nearest unoccupied spaces. These creatures are under your control until destroyed.
{@font {@style 58|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Island Nectar
entries: Consuming this sweet potion gives you a calming sensation before reinvigorating your life force and pushing you into action. You regain 100 hit points, and as part of the same bonus action to consume it, you can immediately make a melee weapon attack, cast a spell that targets only one creature or object, or move up to your speed.
{@font {@style 59|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Elixir of Omnimind
entries: This pale blue potion smells like ozone. When you drink it, your mind expands, and you gain a brief but exceptional capacity to comprehend the vast complexities of the arcane. For the next minute, you can concentrate on two spells at the same time. If you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your {@status concentration}, you must make a separate saving throw for each spell.
{@font {@style 60|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Melodious Bird Calls
entries: When you drink this frothy liquid, you can perfectly mimic the call of any songbird for 24 hours.
{@font {@style 1|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Projected Thoughts
entries: When you drink this gritty potion, a 1-foot-diameter bubble emerges from the top of your head. The bubble lasts for 1 hour and moves with you, remaining centered on you. Until this effect ends, you can choose to project your thoughts into the bubble, where they manifest as illusory but silent words or images (your choice), which anyone can see.
{@font {@style 2|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Intoxicating Aroma
entries: When consumed, you smell of an expertly crafted perfume. The effects of this potion last for 22 years. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting your body at once.
{@font {@style 3|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Ladybug Kinship
entries: When opened, this potion begins to evaporate quickly. For 1 minute, as the potion evaporates, ladybugs fly out of the bottle at a rate of 500 per round. The potion stops producing ladybugs once it has fully evaporated.
{@font {@style 4|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Essence of Umami
entries: This potion makes everything taste amazing. When you pour it on any food, no matter if it's a hunk of tofu or a slab of slow-roasted brisket, essence of umami makes it glow with magic. When the food is tasted, it magically gives the taster their own personal version of the ultimate culinary experience.
{@font {@style 5|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Vocal Stranger
entries: Once imbibed, you can perfectly mimic the speech of a person you're not familiar with. If you can't think of a person you've never met, you instead mimic a random voice. The effects of the potion last for 1 hour.
{@font {@style 6|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Beard Brew
entries: Drinking this fuzzy liquid gives the sensation of wool rubbing against your entire body. When consumed, you instantly grow facial hair, even if you would not normally be able to do so. The style of facial hair is random, and it stays on your face until shaven off. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting your body at once.
{@font {@style 7|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Photosynthetic Skin
entries: This vibrant green potion tastes like freshly cut grass. For the next 24 hours, while the sun is out, you regain 1 hit point at the start of every hour.
{@font {@style 8|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Paradise Plumage
entries: After drinking this potion, you are instantly adorned with striking and distinctive plumage. You can control it to create dazzling displays of shimmering feathers, iridescent colors, and stunning patterns. When you do so, you gain advantage on all Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made to distract or amaze. The effects of this potion last for 24 hours.
{@font {@style 9|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Musical Mixer
entries: When uncorked, this silvery elixir produces beautiful, ethereal music for 1 hour as it slowly evaporates.
{@font {@style 10|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Stink Brew
entries: It stinks, and now so do you! After drinking this potion, all other creatures within 15 feet of you must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be unable to willingly move closer to you for the duration. A creature that hasn't yet made this save must immediately do so when it moves within 15 feet of you. The effects of the potion last {@dice 1d4} rounds.
{@font {@style 11|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Duko the Trickster's Elixir
entries: This potion is easily mistaken for brackish water. Once you drink it, you can produce an egg, rock, coin, or 2-foot-long string from your mouth. This effect lasts until utilized. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting your body at once.
{@font {@style 12|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Manifested Nostalgia
entries: After consuming this clear and flavorless potion, you quickly undergo a radical transformation, becoming the child version of yourself for the next 4 hours. For the duration, you are one size smaller (to a minimum of Small), and your Strength and Dexterity become 10, unless those scores are already less than 10.
{@font {@style 13|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Pigment
entries: When consumed, this multicolored potion allows you to produce a variety of oil paints from the tips of your fingers. You can change the color of the paints at will, and they never seem to run out. The effects of the potion last for 8 hours.
{@font {@style 14|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Audio Oddity
entries: When opened, this embarrassing and noisy potion sounds like a man sobbing. When consumed, this potion strangely mutes the sound produced by any spell cast by the imbiber for the next 1 hour.
{@font {@style 15|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Hindsight
entries: A well-known potion amongst investigators and merchants, this thick brew acquires special insight on an object when poured over it. The only downside is that you must then lick the brew off the object to obtain any of this information. When poured and then licked off, the potion reveals a minor but useful bit of information about the object.
{@font {@style 16|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Super Singing
entries: When consumed, this potion tastes as if it were a freshly brewed tea with the perfect amount of honey mixed in. For the next hour, you are unable to speak without singing, and you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks using your voice.
{@font {@style 17|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Fluffplum Tonic
entries: This nearly weightless liquid grants to drinkers the attributes of a dandelion, allowing them to float safely to the ground when falling and be easily carried by the wind. For the next hour, you are under the effects of the {@spell Feather Fall} spell and weigh no more than 1 pound.
{@font {@style 18|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Merriment
entries: Is this just booze? For the next hour, you become incredibly intoxicated. For the duration, you gain expertise in a skill of your choice, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. Until this effect ends, all ability checks you make that don't use the chosen skill are made with disadvantage.
{@font {@style 19|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Bubble Message
entries: As part of the bonus action to consume this potion, you speak a message and hiccup a bubble, which magically contains the message inside it. You then describe a creature you are familiar with and the bubble floats to that creature, traveling at a speed of 1 mile per hour, and then pops. The bubble pops early if it takes any damage. When the bubble pops, it releases the contained message in your voice.
{@font {@style 20|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Crystal Clear
entries: This aqua-blue potion feels cold to the touch and raises the hairs on your arm when opened. When poured into a non-magical liquid, it turns the liquid {@condition invisible} for {@dice 1d4} hours. If the liquid the potion is poured into is larger than a 20-foot cube, the potion has no effect.
{@font {@style 21|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Elder Elixir
entries: This unassuming potion temporarily doubles your age when consumed. The effects of the potion last {@dice 1d12} months. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting your body at once.
{@font {@style 22|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Witch's Hidden Gem
entries: This bland and underwhelming-looking potion coats your mouth and gullet as you drink it, leaving a thin film. For the next hour, all liquid you consume turns into wine when you drink it.
{@font {@style 23|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Carbonated Snake
entries: When shaken and pointed in a direction, the contents of this zippy elixir shoot out of the bottle, turning into a poisonous snake midair and landing in a space within 10 feet of you.
{@font {@style 24|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Shadow Child
entries: You are filled with intense feelings of confusion before an apparition emerges from your body that resembles a young girl with onyx skin and hair and piercing green eyes. Only you can see it, and it can't speak. It functions as the {@spell Unseen Servant} spell and lasts for 1 hour.
{@font {@style 25|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Hsirebbig
entries: This bitter potion grants you a special form of speech that sounds like absolute gibberish to anyone who isn't also under the effects of a hsirebbig potion. Even spells like Comprehend Languages fail to decipher this speech. The effects of this potion last 24 hours.
{@font {@style 26|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Sky Swimming
entries: After drinking this potion, you feel the sudden and unpleasant feeling of wearing soaking-wet clothing. For the next 10 minutes, you gain a flying speed of 15 feet and can hover, but it looks and feels as if you're swimming through the sky. While flying in this way, you must also obey the rules for underwater combat.
{@font {@style 27|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Passing Memory
entries: When brewed, this powerful elixir stores one of the creator's memories of their choice within it. When consumed by another creature, that creature gains the stored memory.
{@font {@style 28|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Bottled Slime
entries: This mischievous little slime can sometimes form in place of a potion. If noticed before being consumed, it can be thrown to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you, releasing the slime when it shatters. After hurling the potion, a soda slime appears in the space and acts of its own volition.
{@font {@style 29|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Oil of the Trademark Flourish
entries: When you apply this oil to an object, you assign a signature sound that accompanies the object when it's used. This effect is {@b permanent} unless removed as if it were a curse.
{@font {@style 30|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Mosspot
entries: After drinking this earthy mixture, your form quickly shifts and shrinks. You immediately polymorph into a mossling spirit, as if by the spell. This effect doesn't require your {@status concentration} and ends after 1 hour.
{@font {@style 31|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Incredible Luck
entries: After drinking this wonderful liquid, your spirits lift and optimistic feelings pour over you. You gain advantage on the next {@dice 1d4} ability checks, attack rolls, or saving throws you make.
{@font {@style 32|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Grand Friendship
entries: This potion can be divided into as many as eight parts. When two or more creatures consume this golden elixir, they gain a conditional ability to fly. For the next 24 hours, creatures that consumed the elixir gain a flying speed of 60 feet, but only while holding hands with all other creatures that partook of the potion.
{@font {@style 33|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Witch's Lament
entries: Once consumed, this potion calls forth a rain cloud that weeps for you. Then, in a flash of lightning, your head takes on the form of an anthropomorphic animal chosen by the GM. This effect is {@b permanent}.
{@font {@style 34|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Spirit Appendage
entries: This bitter, unappealing elixir turns your stomach and is often a fight to keep down your gullet. Once consumed, you grow a 6-foot-long prehensile tail, which takes a form decided by the GM. The tail can be used as if it were a third arm and can easily support your own weight. The tail lasts for {@dice 1d12} days before falling off.
{@font {@style 35|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Move a Thing
entries: When poured over an object that weighs 500 pounds or less, it begins to weigh lighter and lighter. The object weighs up to {@dice 1d100} pounds less at the start of every hour until it weighs exactly 10 pounds. It remains weighing 10 pounds for 1 week, after which the effects of this potion fade.
{@font {@style 36|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Gobble Gunk
entries: This unappealing potion allows the imbiber to eat whatever they can fit in their mouth with no ill effect—metal, poison, seawater: you name it, you eat it. The effects of this potion last 1 hour. Any magical objects consumed in this way are hurled back up after the end of the hour.
{@font {@style 37|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Pocket Portal
entries: When buried and left to sit for 24 hours, this potion will sprout and form a temporary portal to the Spirit Realm from knotted roots and mud. The portal stays open for 24 hours before closing.
{@font {@style 38|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Don't Eat Dirt
entries: When consumed, this viscous brew tastes like wet soil. For the duration, you become immune to the {@condition prone} condition. Whenever you would fall {@condition prone}, you instead stand up as if an {@condition invisible} force kept you that way. Even by choice, you cannot go {@condition prone}. The effects of this potion last 10 days.
{@font {@style 39|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Lunar Elixir
entries: When poured out, this silvery liquid rapidly expands and coats the surrounding area, creating a chalky white sheen across everything it touches. For the next 8 hours, gravity in a 20-foot-radius, 300-foot-high cylinder centered on the potion is like the moon's gravity. The jump distance for all creatures inside the cylinder is tripled, and falling damage taken inside the cylinder is halved.
{@font {@style 40|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Lifetime Supply
entries: When consumed, this potion causes your hair to grow at an accelerated rate. Roll {@dice 1d4 + 2} and multiply it by 100 to find out how many feet of hair you grow. After 1 minute, the potion wears off and all your hair falls out.
{@font {@style 41|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Invisible Tonic
entries: When poured over an object that is Small or smaller, the object becomes {@condition invisible}. The effects of this potion last until removed, as if it were a curse.
{@font {@style 42|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Liquid Disguise
entries: When brewed, this potion takes on the essence of a random humanoid within 1 mile. A creature that consumes the potion takes on the visage of that creature for the next 24 hours.
{@font {@style 43|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Spirit Sweets
entries: This bitter concoction tastes and smells horrible to physical beings, yet couldn't taste more delicious to spirits, many of which would trade quite a bit for a sip of the brew. A spirit with a challenge rating of 8 or lower that consumes this potion becomes drunk and happy for {@dice 1d4} days. Alternatively, the potion can be poured out, attracting spirits with a challenge rating of 2 or lower that are within 1 mile. When poured out, the potion attracts spirits for 8 hours or until it is consumed.
{@font {@style 44|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Shadow Puppet
entries: Once consumed, this potion gives sentience to your shadow. The shadow starts to act independently of you but is still bound to your body. It has its own emotions and personality but can't interact with the world in any way beyond what a normal shadow could. The effects of this potion last until removed, as if it were a curse. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting your body at once.
{@font {@style 46|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: A New Look
entries: When consumed, this unassuming elixir magically transforms your head into a random anthropomorphic animal, such as a horse, panda, pig, or raccoon. This effect lasts until removed, as if it were a curse. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting your body at once.
{@font {@style 45|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Object Embodiment
entries: When you drink this metallic potion, your body twists and alters into an object of your choice, as if by the {@spell true polymorph} spell. This effect doesn't require your {@status concentration} and ends after 1 hour.
{@font {@style 47|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Phoenix Elixir
entries: When imbibed, this elixir burns your throat and ignites an ember within you. For 24 hours, you are immune to fire damage. When the potion's magic finally fades, the fire inside of you burns intensely from within, consuming you in flames and turning your body to ash. 1 hour later you appear in the nearest bonfire, reborn anew. All objects and clothing that were on your person when you were turned to ash are left by your original body.
{@font {@style 48|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Unknown Elixir
entries: This bizarre blend of flavors reminds you of freshly cut grass, petroleum jelly, and honey. When consumed, it sits in your stomach like a rock and slowly swells in power. You gain the ability to cast one random spell of 6th level or lower, without expending a spell slot. This spell uses a save DC of 17 and a spell attack bonus of +9. The effects of this potion last until the spell is cast. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting your body at once.
{@font {@style 49|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Illusion in a Bottle
entries: When this potion is poured out, an illusion of your choice appears in its space, as if by the {@spell Major Image} spell. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful DC 18 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. The illusion lasts for 1 hour.
{@font {@style 50|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Homegrown
entries: When poured over a surface that is at least a 50-footsquare area and isn't obstructed by obstacles (such as trees or boulders), this pungent liquid begins to quickly foam and expand. After 1 minute, a newly formed and furnished home of grand size appears in the space.
{@font {@style 51|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: New Life
entries: The brewer of this potion chooses the likeness of a humanoid that they are familiar with. When imbibed, you take on the illusionary form of the chosen creature. This illusory disguise is perfect in every way and matches both the creature's visage and its voice. Only creatures with the ability to detect magic or see through illusions (as with {@sense truesight}) can discern this disguise. The effects of this potion last for 7 years or until removed, as if it were a curse. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting your body at once.
{@font {@style 53|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Mind Transfer
entries: When imbibed, this acrid elixir loosens your soul from your body and prepares it for transfer. The first time you are touched by a creature after consuming this potion, your mind and soul transfer into that creature's body. While inhabiting the creature's body, you can force it to make a contested Intelligence or Wisdom check (you both choose which ability to use) at the start of each of its turns. If you succeed, you gain total control over the creature until the start of its next turn. While your mind and soul are away, your body is left {@condition unconscious}. If the creature dies while your mind and soul are still inside it, you also die. You inhabit the creature's body for 1 hour, until you dismiss the effect as an action, or until the creature is targeted by a {@spell Dispel Evil and Good} spell.
{@font {@style 52|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Spiritual Rebuke
entries: When poured, this dark elixir stains the earth and creates a 10-foot cube that is void of the island's magic, as if it were under the effects of the {@spell Antimagic Field} spell. This effect lasts for 1 year.
{@font {@style 55|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Newly Found Magic
entries: When consumed, you feel a rush of magical inspiration flow through you. You instantly learn a random 3rd-level spell. You can cast it without expending a spell slot, and once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest. This potion's effect is permanent, and it doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting you at once.
{@font {@style 56|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Ups-A-Daisy
entries: When poured over a creature or object, this creamy elixir instantly awakens the target, as if by the {@spell Awaken} spell. The awakened creature remains {@condition charmed} by you for 1 year, instead of 30 days.
{@font {@style 54|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Crafter's Brew
entries: The crafter's brew can be added to any larger container of water or a small body of water to create an enchanting bath. The first nonmagical object submerged in the water for at least 1 minute gains a permanent magical effect. This effect is random and powerful enough that the item's rarity should be considered uncommon or higher.
{@font {@style 57|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Dancing Feet
entries: After drinking this potion, you no longer walk or run—now you dance. Going from one place to another is no longer a mundane trudge, a shuffling expression of ennui. How you get from point A to point B is now a dazzling dance performance. From smooth, elven waltzes, to Nakudama hops and gyrations, to the interpretive dance forms of the dara, you explore them all. Your stylish moves increase your walking speed by 10 feet, give you a +5 bonus to Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks that involve dancing, and grant you proficiency in Dexterity saving throws if you don't already have it. This lasts until you dismiss the potion's effects as an action.
{@font {@style 58|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Chicken Chaser
entries: When you drink this potion, your hair turns dark red (if you have any), and you gain the ability to speak with chickens permanently, as if by the {@spell Speak with Animals} spell. Additionally, you can crow a sacred and thunderous cackle that summons 100 chickens in a 20-foot radius centered on you. These chickens appear running from a distance, digging out from the ground below, and falling from the sky in a veritable tsunami of flapping, clucking poultry. Each creature in the area (excluding you) must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 30d6} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you've summoned the chickens in this way, you can't do so again. This doesn't count against the number of potions you can have affecting your body at once.
{@font {@style 59|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Disappearing Act
entries: When consumed, your body vanishes along with all the items you were wearing or carrying, and your sentience is transferred into a random object within 100 miles of you.
{@font {@style 60|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Anglerfish Helm
entries: While wearing this helmet, the duration of the {@spell Water Breathing} spell is doubled when cast on you, and you can cause the helmet's antenna to shed {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} in a 20-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} for an additional 20 feet. Additionally, you can cast {@spell Charm Person} from the helmet as a 3rd-level spell. Once you do so, you can't use this property again until the next dawn.

item.name: Baffled Candle
entries: While lit, a creature holding this candle becomes {@condition invisible}. The candle can burn for {@dice 1d4 + 3} minutes. Once the candle fully burns down, the item is destroyed.

item.name: Bell of Resonance
entries: The sound of this little bell causes metal to vibrate violently. As an action, you can ring the bell, causing all creatures wielding metal weapons within 30 feet of the bell to make a DC 14 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature drops its weapon. Once you use this property, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Boots of the Stampede
entries: While wearing these boots, you can move an additional 15 feet whenever you take the {@action DashB} action.

item.name: Burnright Brand Hair Dryer
entries: This hair dryer has 7 charges. It regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells: {@spell Burning Hands} (1 charge), {@spell Cone of Cold} (5 charges), or {@spell Gust of Wind} (2 charges).

item.name: Censer of Arguing Spirits
entries: This tarnished and dented teapot appears like an unimportant mundane item. Sloshing sounds can be heard from within the pot when shaken, and it always feels warm to the touch. When the lid is removed, three tendrils of colored smoke rise from its blackened center. At the top of the tendrils are the smushed faces of 3 elderly men, all of which quickly begin to bicker amongst themselves. You can ask each man one question, and he will answer to the best of his ability. Once you have asked them all a question, they begin to ignore you and continue to argue amongst themselves until the lid is replaced at the top of the pot.
It's unknown who these men were, but each seems to retain knowledge from their past lives. Once you ask one of the men a question, you can't ask him another question until 7 days have passed.

item.name: Canseco Bat
entries: This baseball bat uses the statistics of a +1 warhammer. If a hostile creature misses you with a ranged spell attack while wielding this bat, you can use your reaction to redirect the attack at another creature you can see within 30 feet of you, using this weapon's attack bonus for the new attack roll. Once you use this property, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Coin's Edge
entries: This magical coin has the symbol of a dagger on it. When the coin is flipped into the air, it transforms into a mundane dagger. Once this property is used, it can't be undone.
